purpleculture_pinyin:
jì
to cross a river; to aid or relieve; to be of help
перейти реку; чтобы помочь или облегчить; быть полезным

jǐ
used in place names associated with the Ji River 济水 ; surname Ji
используется в топонимах, связанных с рекой Цзи 济 水; фамилия Джи
rtega_mnemonic:
濟濟RS
济济		済help, aid, relieve, ferry, cross, finish
  • water 氵 next to a field 齊: → 濟/済/济: helping with the work on the field is finished, time to cross the water
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 济)
Pictophonetic: 齊 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
計劃經濟 [ jì huà jīng jì ]: planned economy
濟濟 [ jǐ jǐ ]: large number of people
濟濟一堂 [ jǐ jǐ yī táng ]: to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof
濟南 [ jǐ nán ]: Jinan, subprovincial city and capital of Shandong province in northeast China
濟南市 [ jǐ nán shì ]: Jinan subprovincial city and capital of Shandong province in northeast China

    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water

heisig_chinese_memo: Water always relieves me on hot summer days. I look identical every time - water running down my chin and sweating.
Ru_trainchinese:
jì: (графема) переправляться через реку; помогать, выручать; быть полезным
jǐ: (графема) название места в провинции Шаньдун
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: People react in an identical way when drinking water.  It relieves everyone!
humanum_full_description_en:
" Ji " refers to the ancient Jishui, "Shuwen": "Ji, water. Going out of the Changshan house to praise Huangshan, east into the river. From the water, unison." The inscription "Jiji" expresses the appearance of being cautious. King Zhongshan’s Fanghu: "With the township (feast) God, to worship the ancestors. Mu Mujiji, strict respect does not dare to waste." "Guangya. Shi Xun: "Jiji, respect." "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Chu Ci": "Ji Ji Chong" Zheng Xuan Jian: "Prestige and Caution." "Sui Shu. "Music History": "Its capacity is mumu, its ritual is rich."

" Finance " also means crossing the river. For example, "to help each other in the same boat" refers to crossing the river together in the same boat. It is a metaphor for working together to overcome difficulties. "book. "Daguo": "Yuwei boy, if you wade into the abyss, Yuwei will beg for help." Kong Chuan: "Begging for me so I can help."
humanum_short_description_en: The sound of " ji " from " water ", " together ". " Ji " is the name of a river, and it also means crossing the river.
humanum_full_description:
「濟」指古代的濟水，《說文》：「濟，水。出常山房子贊皇山，東入泜。从水，齊聲。」金文「濟濟」表示敬慎之貌。中山王方壺：「以鄉(饗)上帝，以祀先王。穆穆濟濟，嚴敬不敢怠荒。」《廣雅．釋訓》：「濟濟，敬也。」《詩．小雅．楚茨》：「濟濟蹌蹌」鄭玄箋：「威儀敬慎也。」《隋書．音樂志》：「其容穆穆，其儀濟濟。」

　　「濟」又表示渡河，如「同舟共濟」指同坐一條船，一起過河，比喻同心協力，戰勝困難。《書．大誥》：「予惟小子，若涉淵水，予惟往求朕攸濟。」孔傳：「往求我所以濟渡。」
humanum_short_description: 「濟」從「水」，「齊」聲。「濟」是河流名，又表示渡河。

" Ji" refers to the ancient Jishui, "Shuwen": "Ji, water. Going out of the Changshan house to praise Huangshan, east into the river. From the water, unison." The inscription "Jiji" expresses the appearance of being cautious. King Zhongshan’s Fanghu: "With the township (feast) God, to worship the ancestors. Mu Mujiji, strict respect does not dare to waste." "Guangya. Shi Xun: "Jiji, respect." "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Chu Ci": "Ji Ji Chong" Zheng Xuan Jian: "Prestige and Caution." "Sui Shu. "Music History": "Its capacity is mumu, its ritual is rich." " Finance" also means crossing the river. For example, "to help each other in the same boat" refers to crossing the river together in the same boat. It is a metaphor for working together to overcome difficulties. "book. "Daguo": "Yuwei boy, if you wade into the abyss, Yuwei will beg for help." Kong Chuan: "Begging for me so I can help."

濟字的基本解释

濟
jì

濟
jǐ
均见“济”。

濟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jì］
［《廣韻》子計切，去霽，精。］
亦作“済1”。“济1”的繁体字。
(1)渡河。
(2)渡口。
(3)越过；度过。
(4)流通；贯通。
(5)救助。
(6)调剂；弥补；补益。
(7)增援；增加。
(8)停止。
(9)利用；发挥（作用）。
(10)成功；成就。
(11)濡，沾湿。参见“濟濡”。
(12)充足；齐全。
(13)引申为好。
(14)犹及、如，比得上。
(15)通“霽”。雨雪转晴。
(16)通“隮（躋）”。登上；到达。
[②]［jǐ］
［《廣韻》子禮切，上薺，精。］
亦作“済2”。“济2”的繁体字。
(1)古水名。古四渎之一。《周礼·夏官·职方氏》、《汉书·地理志》、《说文》作“泲”，他书作“濟”。包括黄河南北两部分。
(2)古水名。发源于河北省赞皇县南，东流经高邑县南，至宁晋县南，注入泜水。
(3)见“濟2濟”。
(4)通“擠”。排斥；废弃。
(5)，过滤。
[③]［qí］
［《集韻》前西切，平

濟字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　濟； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页656第01
〔古文〕泲㴉【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?子禮切，音秭。水名。【說文】水出常山郡房子縣贊皇山。【釋名】濟，濟也，源出河北濟河而南也。【風俗通·山澤篇】濟者齊，齊其度量也。【書·禹貢】導沇水，東流爲濟。【傳】泉源爲沇，流去爲濟。　又水名，出酈縣。【山海經】支離之山，濟水出焉。　又濟南，郡名。【廣輿記】漢初爲濟南國，景帝時分郡。　又濟濟，衆盛之貌。一曰多威儀也。【詩·大雅】濟濟多士。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?子計切，音霽。渡也。【揚子·方言】過渡謂之涉濟。【詩·邶風】濟有深涉。　又止也。【詩·鄘風】旣不我嘉，不能旋濟。　又與霽通。亦止也。【爾雅·釋天】濟，謂之霽。【疏】濟，止也。今南陽人呼雨止爲霽。　又成也。【左傳·僖二十年】以欲從人則可，以人從欲鮮濟。　又利用也。【易·繫辭】臼杵之利，萬民以濟。　又益也。【左傳·桓十一年】莫敖曰：盍請濟師于王。又賙救也。【易·繫辭】知周乎萬物，而道濟天下。　又相助也。【易·謙卦】天道下濟而光明。　又

Help
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jì］
["Guang Yun" Zi Ji cut, go to Ji, fine. ]
Also known as "済1". Traditional characters for "济1".
(1) Cross the river.
(2) Ferry.
(3) To cross; to pass.
(4) Circulation; through.
(5) Relief.
(6) Adjust; make up; tonic.
(7) Reinforcement; increase.
(8) Stop.
(9) Use; play (function).
(10) Success; achievement.
(11) Wet, wet. See "Ji Ru".
(12) Sufficient; complete.
(13) The extension is good.
(14) As much as, as comparable.
(15) Through "ji". Rain and snow turned fine.
(16) Through "隮 (Ji)". Board; arrive.
[②]［jǐ］
["Guangyun" Ziliqie, top water chestnut, fine. ]
Also known as "済2". Traditional characters for "济2".
(1) Ancient water name. One of the ancient four dunes. "Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Zhi Fangshi", "Hanshu·Geography", and "Shu Wen" are written as "Ji", and his book is "Ji". Including the north and south parts of the Yellow River.
(2) Ancient water names. It originated in the south of Zanhuang County, Hebei Province, and flows east through Gaoyi County to the south of Ningjin County, where it is injected with water.
(3) See "Ji 2 Ji".
(4) Through "squeeze". Exclusion; abandonment.
(5) , filtering.
[③] [qí]
["Ji Yun" before the west cut, flat
